title: Help with this italic?
content:
It looks like a Baskerville but nothing like what I have. Does anyone recognize it?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203110635im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/ew_3625.gif)

 [‹ Esquire Magazine UK](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203110635/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38811 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Geometric bold sans 'Ongoing Series' - Neuzeit (custom by Laurenz Brunner) {Yves (Angel)} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203110635/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38803 "Go to next forum topic")
author: rickruss

comments.content: [Mrs. Eaves Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203110635/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/mrs-eaves/italic/). Good intuition, as Mrs. Eaves is based on Baskerville, but is of course a nice modern reinterpretation.
Wow. I never would have figured that one out. Thanks!
